alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 17 at 1:58PM PDT until March 22 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 9 inches for communities along US-395 including Bridgeport and Lee Vining, with 1 to 2 feet around June Lake and Mammoth Lakes, and 2 to 3 feet in the Sierra above 8500 feet. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph across Sierra ridgelines on Monday. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional snowfall may exacerbate snow load issues for mountain communities.
info.instruction: Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the storm arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of time.
